pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato ānandassa upajjhāyo āyasmā belaṭṭhasīso araññe viharati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.2.eng: At that time Venerable Belaṭṭhasīsa, Venerable Ānanda’s preceptor, was staying in the wilderness.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.3.pli: So piṇḍāya caritvā sukkhakuraṃ ārāmaṃ haritvā sukkhāpetvā nikkhipati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.3.eng: After walking for alms, he brought plain boiled rice back to the monastery where he dried and stored it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.4.pli: Yadā āhārena attho hoti, tadā udakena temetvā temetvā bhuñjati, cirena gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.4.eng: Whenever he got hungry, he moistened and ate it. As a result, he only went the village for alms after a long time.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.6.pli: “kissa tvaṃ, āvuso, cirena gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.6.eng: “Why do you only go for alms after such a long time?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.7.pli: Atha kho āyasmā belaṭṭhasīso bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.8.pli: “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ, āvuso, sannidhikārakaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñjasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.8.eng: “But do you eat food that you’ve stored?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.10.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.10.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā belaṭṭhasīso sannidhikārakaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñjissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.11.eng: “How can Venerable Belaṭṭhasīsa eat food that he has stored?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.12.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, belaṭṭhasīsa, sannidhikārakaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñjasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.12.eng: “Is it true, Belaṭṭhasīsa, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.15.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, belaṭṭhasīsa, sannidhikārakaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñjissasi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.17.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.17.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.18.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu sannidhikārakaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.18.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats fresh or cooked food that he has stored, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.1.6.eng: received today and eaten on the following day.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.1.8.pli: pañca bhojanāni—yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ ṭhapetvā avasesaṃ khādanīyaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.1.8.eng: apart from the five cooked foods, the post-midday tonics, the seven-day tonics, and the lifetime tonics—the rest is called “fresh food”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.1.10.pli: pañca bhojanāni—odano, kummāso, sattu, maccho, maṃsaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.1.10.eng: there are five kinds of cooked food: cooked grain, porridge, flour products, fish, and meat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.1.11.eng: If he receives fresh or cooked food with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.1.12.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.1.pli: Sannidhikārake sannidhikārakasaññī khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.1.eng: If it has been stored, and he perceives that it has, and he eats the fresh or cooked food, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.2.pli: Sannidhikārake vematiko khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.2.eng: If it has been stored, but he is unsure of it, and he eats the fresh or cooked food, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.3.pli: Sannidhikārake asannidhikārakasaññī khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.3.eng: If it has been stored, but he does not perceive that it has, and he eats the fresh or cooked food, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.4.pli: Yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ āhāratthāya paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.4.eng: If he receives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics for the purpose of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.5.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.6.eng: If it has not been stored, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.7.eng: If it has not been stored, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.8.eng: If it has not been stored, and he does not perceive that it has, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.3.2.eng: if he both stores and eats it during the right time;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.3.3.eng: if he both stores and eats post-midday tonics during the remainder of the day;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.3.4.eng: if he both stores and eats seven-day tonics during the seven-day period;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.3.5.eng: if he uses lifetime tonics when there is a reason;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.3.7.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.3.8.eng: The training rule on storing, the eighth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:0.5.eng: 39. The training rule on fine foods

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū paṇītabhojanāni attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six were eating fine foods that they had requested for themselves.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā paṇītabhojanāni attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.4.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics eat fine foods that they have requested for themselves?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.5.pli: Kassa sampannaṃ na manāpaṃ, kassa sāduṃ na ruccatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.5.eng: Who doesn’t like nice food? Who doesn’t prefer tasty food?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.6.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.6.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.7.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū paṇītabhojanāni attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.8.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six eat fine foods that they have requested for themselves?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, paṇītabhojanāni attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, paṇītabhojanāni attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.12.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.14.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.15.1.pli: “Yāni kho pana tāni paṇītabhojanāni, seyyathidaṃ— sappi navanītaṃ telaṃ madhu phāṇitaṃ maccho maṃsaṃ khīraṃ dadhi. Yo pana bhikkhu evarūpāni paṇītabhojanāni attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a monk asks for any of these kinds of fine foods for himself—that is, ghee, butter, oil, honey, syrup, fish, meat, milk, and curd—and then eats it, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.16.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:1.16.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū gilānā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:2.1.eng: At one time a number of monks were sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:2.2.eng: The monks who were looking after them asked,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:2.3.eng: “I hope you’re bearing up? I hope you’re getting better?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:2.4.pli: “Pubbe mayaṃ, āvuso, paṇītabhojanāni attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjāma, tena no phāsu hoti;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:2.4.eng: “Previously we ate fine foods that we had requested ourselves, and then we were comfortable.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:2.5.pli: idāni pana ‘bhagavatā paṭikkhittan’ti kukkuccāyantā na viññāpema, tena no na phāsu hotī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:2.5.eng: But now that the Buddha has prohibited this, we don’t request because we’re afraid of wrongdoing. And because of that we’re not comfortable.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:2.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:2.7.eng: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:2.8.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānena bhikkhunā paṇītabhojanāni attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:2.8.eng: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to eat fine foods that he has requested for himself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:2.9.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:2.9.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:2.10.1.pli: “Yāni kho pana tāni paṇītabhojanāni, seyyathidaṃ— sappi navanītaṃ telaṃ madhu phāṇitaṃ maccho maṃsaṃ khīraṃ dadhi. Yo pana bhikkhu evarūpāni paṇītabhojanāni agilāno attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:2.10.1.eng: ‘If a monk who is not sick asks for any of these kinds of fine foods for himself—that is, ghee, butter, oil, honey, syrup, fish, meat, milk, and curd—and then eats it, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.3.pli: gosappi vā ajikāsappi vā mahiṃsasappi vā, yesaṃ maṃsaṃ kappati tesaṃ sappi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.3.eng: ghee from cows, ghee from goats, ghee from buffaloes, or ghee from whatever animal whose meat is allowable.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.7.eng: sesame oil, mustard oil, honey-tree oil, castor oil, oil from fat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.11.comm: “Syrup” renders phāṇita. I. B. Horner instead translates it as “molasses”, which doesn’t quite hit the mark. SED defines phāṇita as “the inspissated juice of the sugarcane or other plants”, in other words, “cane syrup”. According to the commentary at Sp 1.623 it can be either cooked or uncooked, the difference presumably whether it is raw or concentrated. “Syrup” seems closer to the mark than “molasses”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.13.eng: what lives in water is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.13.comm: Here I follow the alternative reading udakacaro found in the PTS version. Udako must be an editing mistake.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.15.eng: the meat of those animals whose meat is allowable.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.17.pli: gokhīraṃ vā ajikākhīraṃ vā mahiṃsakhīraṃ vā, yesaṃ maṃsaṃ kappati, tesaṃ khīraṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.17.eng: milk from cows, milk from goats, milk from buffaloes, or milk from whatever animal whose meat is allowable.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.23.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.24.eng: Any of these kinds of fine foods:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.27.eng: who is comfortable without fine foods.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.29.pli: yassa vinā paṇītabhojanāni na phāsu hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.29.eng: who is not comfortable without fine foods.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.30.pli: Agilāno attano atthāya viññāpeti, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.30.eng: If he is not sick and he requests for himself, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.31.eng: When he receives it with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.1.32.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.2.1.pli: Agilāno agilānasaññī paṇītabhojanāni attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.2.1.eng: If he is not sick, and he does not perceive himself as sick, and he eats fine foods that he has requested for himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.2.2.pli: Agilāno vematiko paṇītabhojanāni attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.2.2.eng: If he is not sick, but he is unsure of it, and he eats fine foods that he has requested for himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.2.3.pli: Agilāno gilānasaññī paṇītabhojanāni attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.2.3.eng: If he is not sick, but he perceives himself as sick, and he eats fine foods that he has requested for himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.2.4.eng: If he is sick, but he does not perceive himself as sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.2.5.eng: If he is sick, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.2.6.eng: If he is sick, and he perceives himself as sick, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.3.3.eng: if he asked for it when he was sick, but eats it when he is no longer sick;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.3.4.eng: if he eats the leftovers from one who is sick;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.3.6.eng: if it is from those who have given an invitation;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.3.7.eng: if it is for the benefit of someone else;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.3.8.eng: if it is by means of his own property;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.3.10.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc39:3.3.11.eng: The training rule on fine foods, the ninth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:0.5.eng: 4. The training rule on memorizing the Teaching

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū upāsake padaso dhammaṃ vācenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six were instructing lay followers to memorize the Teaching.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.3.pli: Upāsakā bhikkhūsu agāravā appatissā asabhāgavuttikā viharanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.3.eng: Those lay followers became disrespectful, undeferential, and rude toward the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.4.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū upāsake padaso dhammaṃ vācessanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.5.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six instruct lay followers to memorize the Teaching?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.6.pli: Upāsakā bhikkhūsu agāravā appatissā asabhāgavuttikā viharantī”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.7.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.7.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, upāsake padaso dhammaṃ vācetha;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.9.pli: upāsakā bhikkhūsu agāravā appatissā asabhāgavuttikā viharantī”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, upāsake padaso dhammaṃ vācessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.12.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.13.pli: Upāsakā bhikkhūsu agāravā appatissā asabhāgavuttikā viharanti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.14.pli: Netaṃ, moghapurisā, appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya pasannānaṃ vā bhiyyobhāvāya …pe…

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.15.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.16.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu anupasampannaṃ padaso dhammaṃ vāceyya pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a monk instructs a person who is not fully ordained to memorize the Teaching, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.5.eng: A person who is not fully ordained:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.6.pli: bhikkhuñca bhikkhuniñca ṭhapetvā avaseso anupasampanno nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.6.eng: anyone except a fully ordained monk or a fully ordained nun.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.7.comm: Padaso does not literally mean “memorize”, but something like “by the line”. The reason I have “memorize” here is simply an artifact of my translation of the rule just above. The expression padaso dhammaṁ vāceyya literally means “causing (someone) to say the Teaching by the line”, which implies helping another to memorize the teaching, hence my rendering.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.8.eng: a line, the next line, the next syllable, the next phrase.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.10.eng: they start together and finish together.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.12.eng: one of them starts, but they finish together.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.14.eng: when ‘Rūpaṁ aniccaṁ’ is being said, he prompts him, saying, ‘rū’.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.16.eng: when ‘Rūpaṁ aniccaṁ,’ is being said, the other says, ‘Vedanā aniccā.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.17.pli: Yañca padaṃ, yañca anupadaṃ, yañca anvakkharaṃ, yañca anubyañjanaṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.17.eng: And whatever line there is, whatever next line, whatever next syllable, whatever next phrase—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.20.pli: buddhabhāsito, sāvakabhāsito, isibhāsito, devatābhāsito, atthūpasañhito, dhammūpasañhito.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.20.eng: what has been spoken by the Buddha, what has been spoken by disciples, what has been spoken by sages, what has been spoken by gods, what is connected with what is beneficial, what is connected with the Teaching.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.22.pli: padena vāceti, pade pade āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.22.eng: if he instructs by the line, then for every line he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.23.eng: If he instructs by the syllable, then for every syllable he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.2.1.pli: Anupasampanne anupasampannasaññī padaso dhammaṃ vāceti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.2.1.eng: If the person is not fully ordained, and the monk does not perceive them as such, and he instructs them to memorize the Teaching, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.2.2.pli: Anupasampanne vematiko padaso dhammaṃ vāceti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.2.2.eng: If the person is not fully ordained, but the monk is unsure of it, and he instructs them to memorize the Teaching, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.2.3.pli: Anupasampanne upasampannasaññī padaso dhammaṃ vāceti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.2.3.eng: If the person is not fully ordained, but the monk perceives them as such, and he instructs them to memorize the Teaching, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.2.4.eng: If the person is fully ordained, but the monk does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.2.4.comm: Because the gender of the ordained person is not given, I use “them”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.2.5.eng: If the person is fully ordained, but the monk is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.2.6.eng: If the person is fully ordained, and the monk perceives them such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.3.2.eng: if the recitation is done together;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.3.4.eng: if he prompts one who is speaking a mostly familiar text;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.3.5.eng: if he prompts one who is reciting;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.3.7.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.3.8.eng: The training rule on memorizing the Teaching, the fourth, is finished.
